answers.content_html: The different radiopharmaceuticals travel through different blood vessels.
answers.feedback_html: The body determines where blood flows, not the identify of the chemicals.

answers.content_html: The different radiopharmaceuticals travel to different parts of the body.
answers.feedback_html: Different chemicals travel to different parts of the body.

answers.content_html: The different radiopharmaceuticals are used to treat different diseases of the body.
answers.feedback_html: Imaging uses radiopharmaceuticals that can be detected, not used to treat different diseases.

answers.content_html: The different radiopharmaceuticals produce different amounts of ionizing radiation.
answers.feedback_html: The radiopharmaceuticals would not likely produce ionizing radiation, which kills cells.

stem_html: Why are different radiopharmaceuticals used to image different parts of the body?
